On 4/18/13 12:19 PM, Jian wrote:
> I am using Heritrix 1.14.4 starting with 5000 seeds.
> Most options are just default. But I got quite a few error messages in the seed report, saying that "domain unresolvable". Examples are below:
>
> http://facproductions.net/preprints/
> http://cs.stir.ac.uk/%7Eman/
> http://jameshamilton.eu/sites/default/files/MPhilTransferReport.pdf
>
> these are regular URLs and you can easily access the page content from a regular web browser. But why Heritrix reports this error? Is there any configuration that I did wrong?

Crawling sometimes overwhelms (or hits throttling limits) of DNS 
services... that's what I'd look at first.

There could be more hints in the crawl.log or ARC/WARC records - 
especially if you compare the failures to other successes nearby in 
time. (Do the failures happen in batches then resolve? Do the records 
confirm that the crawler is asking the DNS server you think that it is?)

- Gordon
